website_summaries.verdict: Just a reliable, no-nonsense extension cord that will last a very long time. The best value for your money.
pros: Decent price, heavy-duty cord and very weather resistant
cons: Lacks bells and whistles such as a triple outlet or lighted plugs

customer_reviews.title: Quality Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a leaf blower and also a power washer. I learned the hard way years ago, do not use the 16 gauge extension cords for products like leaf blowers or power washers as they tend to burn up the motors sooner than normal. This is a quality product and is offered at a reasonable price. US Wire has a good reputation. I would highly recommend this product. I hope you find this review helpful. If so, please click on the helpful button for this review.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: High quality extension cord.
customer_reviews.text: Thick, high quality cable - I can believe it really is 12 gauge, compared to some other versions that say 12 gauge, but are really 14 or smaller to skimp on cost (copper is expensive). The fact that it is Made in the USA is great. If you need to run high-current tools on an extension cord, this is your answer. My previous cord (admittedly, it was 14 gauge) would get warm due to the higher resistance combined with high load, whenever I used tools like a circular saw, or especially if I ever plugged in a space heater. This cord never gets warm; the 15A breaker will trip before the cord becomes the bottleneck in the electrical path.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hooke

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty yet easy to coil
customer_reviews.text: This is the most heavy duty extension cord I have ever owned, but it is the easiest to coil up as it is very pliable. Seems like a small thing, but is a noticeable difference that makes using the cord that much easier. Price is right too.
customer_reviews.author: gprent

customer_reviews.title: Is this the best there is? Mine died after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. I'd link them together for mowing, edging, and blowing/mulching leaves. The one that I always connected to the lawn tool has died after 2 years. It has worn due to use over time. I will buy a different product and compare. I notice the other cable is less worn. So this is probably just an issue of something being worn out and not that it's defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but Inconsistent quality...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these extension chords, and the quality of the chord was a bit inconsistent. The first extension chord worked well, and it met all expectations. The second chord appeared to be dry and old, and it is a little less malleable than the first. Ultimately both chords worked well, but I was a little disappointed in the inconsistent quality and/or old stock.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo H

customer_reviews.title: Great product, not cheaply made at all
customer_reviews.text: Great product, not cheaply made at all. The price is low but the product sturdy, I am very happy with my purchase. The only drawback is not with the product but with my lawn mower chord holder (I can't think of the exact wording, but it's the thing that keeps your cord from getting unplugged but holding the cord), The cord holder is too small so I just make a knot on the handle. Good deal, don't hesitate to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Like most people have said, the ONLY downside is the weight - but that is hardly worth mentioning. I do, however, have a question about replacing the male end. I stupidly pull the cord out of the outlet (instead of pulling the plug). The ground prong was torn off, so now I need to replace it. Replacement male plug, circular vs u-shaped. Outdoor outlets are U-shaped (basically flat top/bottom sides like indoor outlets. but have a tiny lip around the outside). Will a circular plug work? I don't want to buy one if it is going to fall out of the outlet. THANKS!!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Huber

customer_reviews.title: The exterior wire jacket is strong but still flexible - My new go-to cord
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when this cord arrived. I thought it was too good to be true to have a 12/3 cord for the price as compared to the big box stores. This is a heavy duty cord and was exactly what I needed for running shop tools away from an outlet. Connections are solid and the exterior wire jacket is strong but still flexible. It still coiled and was flexible enough to use in winter weather as well.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Top quality extension cord MADE IN USA!
customer_reviews.text: MADE IN THE USA! TOP QUALITY CONSTRUCTION. ACTUALLY MEETS AND PERFORMS AT RATED LOAD. Before I bought this cord I bought one with the same rating/specs/length (MADE IN CHINA) from local store that cost 30% more than this one to use for my Toro Ultra Blower/Vac. On high setting the electric motor was not getting adequate voltage/amperage and the cord got extremely hot to the touch. I returned it and ordered this one from Amazon. Long story short, the Toro is running as designed and the cord doesn't get hot at all. Using an extension cord that won't carry the amperage/voltage needed will damage your electric tools.
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: Durable and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Even though it's bad practice, I've had this cord buried for 6 years in order to get power from my house to my travel trailer. I recently dug up portions along the cord's length for landscaping purposes. Except for patchy discoloration, I detected no other problems. It remained as pliant and flexible as when new.
customer_reviews.author: Woodrow Merle

customer_reviews.title: Extended Cord Short Review
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my DA polisher for auto detailing. The plug is in the middle of the garage and I needed the extra length. The gauge is heavy enough that I don't see any power loss on the polisher. The cable gets dragged along a concrete driveway, stepped on, etc, and works just as well as the day I bought it. Rolls up nicely when I need to put it away, too.
customer_reviews.author: Spooky9917

customer_reviews.title: Great cable for use with our 100% Electric 2014 Toyota Rav4 EV
customer_reviews.text: We're using this extension cable in conjunction with the portable Level 2 charging cable that came with our 2014 Toyota Rav4 EV. I use it at work when the spots closest to the outlet are blocked with other cars and I need to plug in. Even though it's 50 feet long, I still get 3 miles of range for every hour plugged in. This is the same amount that I get when I plug in using the cable that came with the vehicle. In other words, there's no loss of juice flowing to the car despite it being 50ft long.......important when charging an electric vehicle. The quicker you can charge up the better.
customer_reviews.author: Desmond

customer_reviews.title: Its American!
customer_reviews.text: Second one I have purchased and I'm not disappointed the quality is great and a million times better than the made in china crap. Don't get me wrong you can find products that are made in china of decent quality but why chance burning down your house when this one is made in the USA and is really heavy duty and meets our guidelines of safety. I plan to purchase two more to get a hundred feet I rather have four sections of twenty five feet than to buy a hundred all together and have to detangle that much cord besides you don't always need that much cord.
customer_reviews.author: O,Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: can handle power tools and welders
customer_reviews.text: Com'on guys- 16 gauge cords are for LAMPS! THIS 12 ga can handle power tools and welders- the price difference is nominal and the difference is noticeable. the lower the number, the thicker the wire. 12 is thicker and can handle more amperage than 16. the '3' means it has a ground pin and corresponding third wire vs the 2 wire ungrounded sort. Quality product by US wire and Cable.Used one for my 100 amp mig welder last year- would not risk a fire from 16 gauge cable...(They get 'hot': amps through too thin a cable)
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied CustomerTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Decent durable quality cord.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a decent quality heavy duty extension cord. Have had and used it for a couple of years now. It's still holding up. Will probably purchase another 50 ft cord for when I need 100 ft of cord.
customer_reviews.author: SQ609 from Trenton, NJ

customer_reviews.title: No lights, that's okay.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and right. So it doesn't have a light on the ends and you will have to walk 100 feet to figure out why there is no power but that's okay with me. It doesn't cost me anything to walk so for me this is a win. Overall this thing is a great bargain. You can spend a ton more for essentially the same product. If I were a contractor and I used this everyday then I would never buy it. The absence of a lighted cable means I could potentially waste a ton of time looking for my power issue when all along it could have been something as simple as my extension cord. As a DIYer, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M. Robles

customer_reviews.title: High-Quality, Outdoor Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: I've never taken the time to make sure that my power cords were actually appropriate for what I was using them for until after I bought my house and didn't want to burn it down due to ignorance. I wanted to get one that was long enough and with a higher gauge than what I need it for, just in case. I use this cord for my electric lawnmower and weedeater and it is perfect. It's very well made and is more than enough to reach all the way around my house to the backyard fence line. There's no noticable build up of heat after hours of use across multiple pieces of equipment in the Texas summer.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Made right in the USA.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find that this was actually made in the USA. I'm very happy with this product. I've only used it a few times, 12 amp string trimmer. The ends seem sturdy and well connected, and the cable stays cool to the touch during use, as it should under modest load. If an end ever fails, I can buy a replacement for $3 which pretty much means both ends could eventually fail, and I would still have a cost effective solution. I expet I shall get decades of service out of this cable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Very Heavy Duty, but with that It's Really Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a heavy duty cord, and they weren't kidding about the heavy -- this thing weighs a ton. It has a lot of copper, obviously. If you don't need the high amp capacity, say for extension lights or light power tools, you might consider a much cheaper 16 gauge model, I use this one solely for my electric mower, which draws a lot of amps. It's really too heavy to use comfortably with electric power hand tools like trimmers and sheers, which only draw a few amps anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Great Faulkner's Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Well made in USA, heavy duty extension cord
customer_reviews.text: This is the best extension cord I have ever owned. It is well made, easy to coil back up and top notch quality. The cord is outdoor rated and can handle any load I would ever use it for. I could not find a similar cord at the home improvement stores where cords of lesser quality and duty rating are overpriced. The only downside is that this cord is heavier and thus more weight to lug around than lower rated cords. Note: I bought this for $30 from Amazon (not a third party seller). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LouA

customer_reviews.title: Scam and sham
customer_reviews.text: Cord stopped working just after the 30 days. They informed me that my return timeline had expired. They told me to contact the manufacturer. The manufacturer said it wasn’t their cord.
customer_reviews.author: jma

customer_reviews.title: seems pretty good quality and great price
customer_reviews.text: seems pretty good quality and great price. uipdate 1/4/17: the female end is worn out. It will spark and not work with anything you plug into it. I am sure I can replace end and it will be better than new, however, it has not saw a lot of use, should have lasted better. The cable itself and the male end are holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: jeff burks

customer_reviews.title: I got two years out of it before the jacket ...
customer_reviews.text: I got two years out of it before the jacket separated from the plug. Not getting a response from the manufacturer regarding the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: TCombel

customer_reviews.title: Should be around for many years
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty 50' extension cord. I'm using it mainly for my 13 amp pole trimmer (for tree branches). It performs well and after extended use the cord is just barely warmer than the ambient temperature. Same for its receptacle and plug. No manufacturing shortcuts here, it is a well made USA product. Buy American!
customer_reviews.author: S McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price, works well with power tools
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic price. I'm using this in the garage with power tools--miter saw, circular saw, and pancake compressor with nail gun, and it works great. We didn't see any other product that came close to the price for this gauge. We aren't contractors though, so it gets put away in a cabinet between uses and doesn't see heavy use every day. I don't know that it would hold up to heavy use, but for our purposes, it is a great cord.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Great price on a nice 12 gauge cord
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $30 and free shipping and its the best deal for a 12 gauge 50 foot cord. It seems like really nice quality. Watch out for 50-100 foot 16 gauge cords because voltage drop and heat can become a big problem. This cord is the right price to not get tempted by cheaper higher gauge cords. Also I bought theas this was cheaper than buying a cord with a 3 socket power block already installed.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Sessoms

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's heavy-duty. And it's heavy. But for some purposes (in my case, an electric mower), you need this type of extension cord. Appears to be very well-made and should give good service if given the most minimal care (like not leaving it out in the sun forever). Don't mow your lawn without one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great extension cord
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep our travel trailer plugged in, just to maintain the battery and run a dehumidifier. It sits in direct sunlight, in the grass, most of the day and still feels / looks new. No issues with rain causing the GFI to trip.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Nice cable, heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Nice cable works as expected. Good value. Use it along with a US Wire 7410 12/3 100 Ft cable to power my GreenWorks 25022 12 Amp Corded 20-Inch Lawn Mower available at -  Also use it to power my Rigid Blower Vac.
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality & Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Pretty heavy duty extension cord, it was at a reasonable price, (better than the local big box store) and I'm glad it's made in the USA, something I'll pay a little extra for. I purchased two of these to plug into my generator during power outages and with the 12/3-guage wire there will be little if any power drop in the 50 foot run. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: G'Pa Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great cord for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time looking for a 12/3e 50 cord at the retail stores, but they were all way more than I wanted to pay. I have welders and compressors that require the thicker wire. This was a great cord for a great price. I have not measured it but it seems short for 50 feet. For now I will believe the label, but will measure and re post if I find a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Razevil

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality 12 guage cable that does the job for my 12 amp WORX leaf blower. I bought 2 x 50ft chords and it worked perfectly. Manufacturer recommends against connecting multiple chords but I occasionally need 100 ft, still did the job although it can get heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Mil

customer_reviews.title: THE Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal Heavy-duty extension cord. Thick outerwear, Real 12 gauge wire. Heavy and ready for outside project. I will be buying another to replace my 100 ft imitation import "Heavy Duty" cord.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: Great Cord.  Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a heavy duty extension cord for my new electric lawnmower. I looked at various places online and in stores. This cord on Amazon was what I needed, and the best price for a 12/3 100' cord. I like the fact that this is made in the USA, is OSHA-approved, and that it has a chart showing different horsepower ratings, amps and what cord you need. The only drawback, which would be with any cord of this type, is the overall weight of the cord. It is definitely heavy to carry around, but nothing you can do about that.
customer_reviews.author: Catman2

customer_reviews.title: Best price available for 12/3 extension cord
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mainly to keep in my new electric vehicle for a quick extension to outlets while I was stopped for awhile. It can only handle standard 110V 12A for this distance, but it's very heavy duty and it has never heated up while charging for (so far) up to 6 hours. Very happy with the purchase, and would buy US Wire brand again if a need for 220V 15A comes around.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kleinberg

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I bought this. I bought it to go with a new chain saw--good cord makes a big difference in getting the most out of your chain saw- or whatever you are using it with.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good extension cord. Tough and well made.
customer_reviews.text: There's not too much to say about extension cords but they should be tough, durable and well made. Obviously made to spec is a given but just the feel of the plug gives you confidence. I used this cord for a project and so cut into the cable and it's not easy going...which is a good sign for durability, safety and longevity. Would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Patience Rewarded
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, as described. Correct construction, good build quality. Better price than the little nearby stores - even with shipping. I was able to wait a couple of days, and it arrived quickly. Can't go wrong with this. One drawback, 12/3 is too fat to fit through the strain-relief/cord hanger on the electric mower it was purchased for. Will have to rig an alternate solution. Not the cords fault.
customer_reviews.author: JHexatthewheel

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A SERIOUS EXTENSION CORD!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A SERIOUS EXTENSION CORD! Its big heavy and will hold ALOT of LOAD. Perfect for your shop, or a BIG Gaming PARTY,We used it a a big LAN to power several systems with load to spare. Its made in the USA and looks like it!!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: What am I doing wrong?
customer_reviews.text: I believe that the one I received is defective. I’ve tried multiple outlets and have left this thing plugged in for up to three days but it just will not hold a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bowers

customer_reviews.title: This is great product at a fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: This is great product at a fantastic price, I looked at the local Walmart store and other places and I could not find anything close to this price, this has good heavy ends, we have a few parties where we use multiple crock pots and roasters and so we need a 12 gauge wire, this one works perfect for us..
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: A quality Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these extension cords two months ago and finally put them to use. They were purchased to replace two old cords that were showing their age. The new cords look identical to the old cords and though it is no longer possible to read the manufacturer's marking it is possible they were from the same manufacturer. I received ten years of year round outdoor service in all types of weather from the old extension cords and see nothing to make me believe that the new cords are not capable of giving me the same service.
customer_reviews.author: RDLilly

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy gauge cord, and that's why i got it - I needed the current capacity for an electric snow thrower. it works nicely! If you buy a 12-gauge extension cord, be aware that the diameter of the wiring and insulation is large and heavy. If you're going to use it in low temperatures like I do, it's going to be stiff and difficult to work with. But that's why it works as it's supposed to. Got this at a great price and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: surfbass

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty, durable, works well
customer_reviews.text: Made in the USA, durable, heavy duty cord. Worked great this winter with our generator, carried the load without issue. Storage can be a small challenge as the cord is thicker and heavier than the average basic extension cord, but that was expected with a product like this one. I'm a big fan and definitely suggest everyone give this manufacturer a try. Plus you support companies right here in the USA, which is always a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lord

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and good value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with power tools that draw 12A to 15A and only wish I'd bought it sooner. The lightweight, inexpensive 16-gauge extension cords just can't supply that kind of current without a significant voltage drop, which isn't good for your tools. It's nice to be able to run a 15A demolition hammer a hundred feet from the nearest outlet. This cord is heavy but there's no getting around that, copper weighs what it does.
customer_reviews.author: KevinR

customer_reviews.title: Durable extension cord
customer_reviews.text: This extension cord is just the right length and durable yet flexible enough to wind up and unwind easily.
customer_reviews.author: CL Sallaz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but only 47 ft long
customer_reviews.text: Solid quality, using it for my 15 amp blower and tree cutter. Knocked off 1 star because it's only 47 ft and not 50 ft
customer_reviews.author: Informed Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Should have been obvious but in order to make a 12gague cord they needed to add a little heft. This is a little thicker and heavier than the smaller gauges. In return you get the peace of mind knowing that your cord isn't the weak link in the electrical chain. I notice a difference in how my electric mower runs with this cord vs some of my lighter ones. I wouldn't have noticed if I hadn't tried it but the motor seems to struggle a bit when using the lighter cord.
customer_reviews.author: jptsr1

customer_reviews.title: Great Cord, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Great value on a good product. Good luck finding such a good price on a heavy duty cord like this in the box store.
customer_reviews.author: Leefrd

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty cord
customer_reviews.text: I needed/wanted a new heavy duty extension cord to replace a very old one that wants to overheat more and more after a hard life. This US Wire 12/3 cord is certainly heavy duty, and it is a great value. I don't use it with heavy duty appliances or tools often, but it's nice to have a cord on hand that can handle some voltage when I need it. I would recommend this cord.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good cord. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I need a new power cord for my electric lawn mower, and the US Wire 65050 12/3 50-Foot SJTW Orange Heavy Duty Extension Cord does the job. It's well built and fairly flexible. The 12 Gauge, heavy duty wire handles my mower and trimmer without any issues. It also costs less than other "heavy duty" power cords. It does everything I ask, and is a good value. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DLH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cord
customer_reviews.text: We have found out (the hard way) that we have to use 12 gauge for our 25 or 50 foot cords and 10 gauge for the 100 foot cords. This cord has a great female receptacle - so far, it puts up with the abuse. We have found that 14 gauge cords are too light to run power tools - they're only good for lights or some other light-duty application.
customer_reviews.author: Don Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty extension cord for great price.
customer_reviews.text: Use this to power my electric chainsaw. Works like a charm. Heavy duty and seems like it will last a LONG time.
customer_reviews.author: K Duncan

customer_reviews.title: I must have gotten a different cord...
customer_reviews.text: I see reviews stating that the cord is stiff, but mine was a like a cooked noodle despite its gauge. This cord is the equal in all meaningful ways that I can think to my Yellow Jacket cord, which I consider to be among the best. But Yellow Jacket isn't made in the US anymore, so this one wins. When the time comes to buy more cords, I know where to go. I just hope they're still made in the US when that time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Scotch

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in and forget it!
customer_reviews.text: Solid cable. I use it to plug in my 40' Monaco RV. Runs the fridge, charges the batteries, and keeps everything in tip-top shape. Doesn't get quite so warm at the ends like a cheap cable does.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what happened
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived looking used and worn. Not sure what happened. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: CustomerKT

customer_reviews.title: very nice heavy cord i only use this to run a ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice heavy cord i only use this to run a 110v hobart mig welder off of a 30amp outlet cord never gets hot and the breaker never pops like it did with the standard size cords
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Tough, great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty extension cord that will not let you down. Any cord that is 100 ft long should be 12/3 wire, it's heavy but it can carry the current your tools need. I replaced a cheap 14/3 cord that had the thin insulation wear out exposing some bare live wire over time. The first time I plugged in an electric leaf blower to this cord I actually noticed the increased power at the blower compared to the older extension cord. No signs of wear so far, no twists when you coil it up.
customer_reviews.author: PDH

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty for a lower price
customer_reviews.text: I use this so I can vacuum my car at my house. It wasn't as long as I thought, but it works just fine for what I need. It isn't cheap, it's definitely heavy duty. Great for people looking for a solid cord for not a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Strange

customer_reviews.title: They are durable ad flexible even in cold weather.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the extension cards everyday They are durable, flexible and exceptional amp control over the 100 ft cord. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dwane

customer_reviews.title: GREAT quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: Amazon was nice enough to locate the cord for me, even though it was backordered. GREAT quality. Does not kink. What a difference too, between this one, a 12-gauge and a cheapo 16-gauge cord. I had no idea how powerful my 13A electric leaf blower was until I used this heavy cord. The motor seems to spin at least 50% faster!
customer_reviews.author: Nutmegger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Have used this extension cord numerous times over the last several years to connect my electric jack hammer to the portable generator with not problems
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Great Extension Cord
customer_reviews.text: I bought this extension cord to use w/ the charger that came w/ our plug-in hybrid car. So far, it has handled the electrical load/demand from the car charger.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: this one good quality for 29
customer_reviews.text: some brand's or types up to $ 60.00 .... why. this one good quality for 29.00 ... and furthermore.my dewalt 575sb and my makita 5007 mga both say 12 guage for 50' .... why pay more ??? just cover's all my 15 amp tool's. !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: david. p

customer_reviews.title: The only choice for a general purpose extension cord.
customer_reviews.text: This cable is a no-brainer. It is much cheaper and SO HEAVY! If you want a cable that can handle ANY device you want to plug into your 15 amp household receptacle, get this. Don't waste money at Lowe's or Home Depot. They sell the same thing for more than the $30 I paid for this.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased based on the high ratings given by other purchasers - I have not yet put mine to the test, but as it came in about three days under no cost shipping I was both surprised and pleased with the delivery. That that time I figured I'd put it right to use, but I have not yet done so. Still the delivery speed, the apparent quality (weighs a "ton") and the low Amazon price makes this item a 5-star winner in my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry_NJ

customer_reviews.title: Good cord
customer_reviews.text: I cut these down to the length I needed and added my own ends to run power from a solar powered 2000watt inverter to the frig and entertainment system and had enough left over to run another line to the back den. worked perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Braddy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality extension cord!
customer_reviews.text: This extension cord is the highest quality cord I have ever owned. We use it with our, and it works like a champ. You definitly get what you pay for and theis premium quality!
customer_reviews.author: Lance J. Parry

customer_reviews.title: Good value for this size cord.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my 13 amp electric lawnmower. I bought two 50ft cords. I only need the one for my back yard. I use the second cord when I do the front yard. It was cheaper to buy the two 50ft cords rather than the 100ft. The cords are relatively pliable & easy to manage considering that they are 12/3 rated.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the quality and construction of this cord. It very heavy duty and resists kinking when you wrap it up. I would strongly recommend this product to anyone wanting a purely functional, well made piece of equipment. It was a good buy and I am obviously very pleased. I've been using it daily for about two months.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Looked at the box stores and local discount/hardware stores for heavy duty cords. This is the best value by far. Connections are well-made and durable, other than that an extension cord is an extension cord. Some of the reviews mention the potential issue of cold weather and stiffness. Don't live in a real cold area, but have used it outside in 30 degree weather and it is flexible enough for that.
customer_reviews.author: Garage woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Good Cord.  Don't overload a cheap extension cord.  Buy heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cord to replace a Home Depot Husky cord that I had used for three years. I need an indoor/outdoor cord for hedge trimming and leaf blowing. My Craftsman electric leaf blower is nothing fancy but it pulls 12 amps. The old cord was rated to handle that much (barely) and it used to get hot at the female end after extended use. This US Wire cord is rated to 15 amps and it performs great. No worries about overloading. I think I bought the old cord thinking it was "good enough" and I could save a few bucks. Now I wish I had bought a heavy duty cord in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Product as Described
customer_reviews.text: Made in U.S.A. I ordered this product to be used with Sun Joe electric lawn mower and a black and decker hedge trimmer . The cable is pretty thick but it remains flexible and easy to move around. I also like the bright orange color. It helps me to see where the cord is to prevent accidental cut while using my power tools.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor heavy duty 12/3 Extension cord
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised to learn it was made in the good old US Of A. I am using the Extension cord to power my portable 12k Air Conditioner in my Motorhome. Works great and the cord does not get hot as it is rated at least 3 amps and 3000 watts above the operating required current. Above all it is a quality product which I would buy again if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Bil

customer_reviews.title: great value extension cord.
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty 12/3 extension for about 2/3 the price an equal length lesser quality cord from a big box hardware store have not put it through extensive use yet but initially very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: bambambigelow

customer_reviews.title: It's a good thing to wish you bought a different one.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have purchased a 14/3 75-foot, or even a 16/3 100-foot cord instead. This one is very heavy duty, and way heavier than I needed. If you need heavy duty, this one is the right one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Notloc

customer_reviews.title: Fine Exercise Device
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine exercise device. It is reasonably flexible and it weighs 15 lbs. You will become reasonably flexible and weigh 15 lbs less yourself if you use it with a lawn mower as I do. It also doubles as a well-made, effective electrical connector which does a fine job of powering the mower.
customer_reviews.author: C. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cord to use with a YardForce 8000 13A leaf shredder. This cord performed exactly as expected - it worked out of the box, and continued to work flawlessly without noticeable temperature rise during two 4-hour shredding sessions. This cord is an excellent buy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cologgi

customer_reviews.title: Could be assembled better
customer_reviews.text: Orange outer wrap slides out of the black cord end, exposing wires inside...
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: I used it with my green works more today and it truly is heavy duty. Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Sahira

customer_reviews.title: Super Nice
customer_reviews.text: This cord kicks major ass. What can I say? Extremely heavy duty...have not used it yet and it is just what the Dr ordered.
customer_reviews.author: David Glazer

customer_reviews.title: Kick it pull it no tangles.
customer_reviews.text: Tough rough and made in America have owned these for over a year they have True Grit!
customer_reviews.author: David Disch

customer_reviews.title: very decent extension cord
customer_reviews.text: I don't recall ever owning an extension cord longer than 50' so this 100' provided a huge amount of anticipation when I first unwound it. 100' is fairly heavy so take note of that when purchasing. the 12/3 gauge was too thick to be pinched and curled on the no-snag hooks of my yard tools (leaf blower, hedge trimmer) so there were times the cord would get unplugged simply because of it's weight and drag on the ground. I found myself wrapping the cord slack around my wrist to prevent the cord from being yanked while in use. I'd recommend this extension cord to friends, but I'd make sure to tell them of the thickness dilemma.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pell.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to. I needed this to properly power a snowblower. The cord is indeed semi-flexible so don't expect this will be very easy to manage. Comes with a lifetime limited warranty. Is all weather rated. Perfect for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mike JM

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: Checked the local prices for a 12 gauge cord. Way too expensive, about twice the price of this one. It was even lower priced than the 14 gauge. Very good quality by a well known company. It does as expected and carries the load without flipping breaker at a long distance or bogging down.
customer_reviews.author: SK Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty and Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this extension cord for my swimming pool pump. This cord is exceptional for the price. It is heavy duty, yet very pliable which allows it to be coiled rolled neatly. This cord is better than what I expected. If you are looking for an indoor/outdoor heavy duty extension cord, I can't recommend this one highly enough! I am going to order a couple more to have on hand at the house.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Jennings

customer_reviews.title: This cord is clearly much better and was well worth the higher price for outdoor ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Amazon basics cord and it caught on fire in it's first outdoor use. That cord was a 16/3 cord. This cord is clearly much better and was well worth the higher price for outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase on Amazon to Date
customer_reviews.text: I can't begin to describe how pleased I am with the quality and value of this extension cord. I will be purchasing more in the very near future. I love how they are made in the U.S.A, and they are OSHA compliant. This blows all of my old-school small gauged extension cords purchased from the big box stores out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: autocad_junkie

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice heavy-duty cord
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice heavy-duty cord. If you're doing any sort of work with power tools, this should be the minimum gauge you're plugging into, otherwise you'll keep running back to the breaker box. This cord is pretty resistant against kinking, and it's stood up to getting trampled on pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: working good
customer_reviews.text: working great so far, outside use plugged up my motor home to friends house, in humid weather.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: For just $30 over brick and mortar prices I got two 100' cords instead of one. At 100' and 1kW draw, I am dropping only 3V which is great. I can now use my blower and my compressor just about anywhere on my property. The cord is well made and I am happy with my purchase. While not an aspect of the product, I opted for the super saver shipping. It arrived in an amazing two days.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan D. Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Finally a heavy duty extension cord like the ones I used to use a long time ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally a heavy duty extension cord like the ones I used to use a long time ago. Remember the ones that could get run over on the jobsite and no one would flinch? These are like that.
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great and it's a great price, imo. Perfect combo. It's what I always strive for; however it kept falling out of my Troy-bilt blower. I think it's really the blower's design that's at fault-though. I also used it while edging this morning with no problems. It's also orange, and I like an orange extension cord. I had to buy it after the third-prong fell out of the cheap extension cord I had.
customer_reviews.author: Margarida B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy outdoor cord
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our outdoor Christmas lights. Having used it for several weeks, it's proven to withstand the winds and rains of the season. It's heavy duty and will last for years and years.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent HEAVY Duty extension cord that has all the proper ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent HEAVY Duty extension cord that has all the proper safety certifications. It is great for running devices that require a large amount of current with very low voltage loss. Great for a contractor, probably overkill for the average weekend do it yourselfer.
customer_reviews.author: D Crowder

customer_reviews.title: I especially love how well it coils compared to my other cords
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had gone with the 75-foot just for extra flexibility on what I want to use it with, but I can't complain about this item. I use it for my electric lawnmower, so it gets dragged around the yard, hung up on the porch, etc. So far it has worn very well. I especially love how well it coils compared to my other cords.
customer_reviews.author: BTDUBS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cord that I would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.text: This is the bomb! I use it with my home charger for my CMax Energi Plug In Hybrid. Heavy enough to handle the load of the CMax Energi charger and never heats up. This is a great cord that I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Hefty extention cord
customer_reviews.text: This is a very hefty cable, using 12-gauge, 3-conductor wire. It has heavy-duty insulation and hefty plug and socket. This is a really good deal compared to what you get at the big box home stores.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Best price I could find on a good-quality, heavy-duty gauge 50-ft extension cord. Construction is solid. Casing is thick, plugs are solid. Been using it a lot outdoors with a miter saw, circular saw, and air compressor and it has held up great.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Well-made extension cord that is well matched to the amp ...
customer_reviews.text: Well-made extension cord that is well matched to the amp requirements of most power tools and gardening equipment. I bought this to use with an electric lawn mower. Compare to similar extension cords at Home Depot that sell for $50 and it is clear that this is an outstanding value.
customer_reviews.author: Crankie-Frankie

product_meta.title: US Wire and Cable ELC0004 Extension Cord, 50ft, Orange
product_meta.description:
Size:50 ftUS Wire and Cable 65050 Extension Cord, 50ft, Orange

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
All U.S. Wire cord sets and Pow-R-Blocks are double insulated - individually insulated conductors surrounded by an outside jacket - with solid molded plugs. Outer jacket will not mar floors or walls and is resistant to abrasion and deterioration from moisture and sunlight. Indoor/Outdoor SJTW vinyl cord sets constructed with double insulation and molded-on plugs. Orange, non-marring outer jacket.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA or China
